Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.Name: Mashed_Ashlands_UnstableMineBase
Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.enterDescription: The tunnels of this mine have been rendered highly unstable due to seismic activity. Instability will fluctuate over time, periodically causing parts of the tunnels to collapse.

Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.label: abandoned ebony mine
Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.description: An old ebony mine that was abandoned due to increasing instability. The entrance may be restored to obtain the valuable ebony left behind, though many of the tunnels may have since collapsed. Periodic seismic activy may cause further cave-ins.
Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.mutatorExtraDescription: The tunnels are rich in volcanic ebony, though are unstable due to seismic activity.

Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.label: abandoned malachite mine
Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.description: An old malachite mine that was abandoned due to increasing instability. The entrance may be restored to obtain the valuable malachite left behind, though many of the tunnels may have since collapsed. Periodic seismic activy may cause further cave-ins.
Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.mutatorExtraDescription: The tunnels are rich in volcanic malachite, though are unstable due to seismic activity.

Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.label: abandoned kwama egg mine
Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.description: An old kwama egg mine that was abandoned due to increasing instability. The entrance may be restored to obtain the valuable kwama eggs left behind, though many of the tunnels may have since collapsed. Periodic seismic activy may cause further cave-ins.
Mashed_Ashlands.UndercaveTypeDef.mutatorExtraDescription: The tunnels are filled with kwama eggs, though are unstable due to seismic activity.
